Cause(s): The system has reset after a low voltage event.
Correction(s): Make sure that the system has at least 12 V. Note: At 10 V to 10.5 V the reset will occur.

Cause(s): The system has reset after a low voltage event.
Correction(s): Check the power connections for reliable supply.

Cause(s): The processor got stuck in a task.
Correction(s): Continue operation. If problem persists, do a Factory Reset.

Cause(s): The hub did not write correctly to the FLASH memory
Correction(s): Upload software to hub.

Cause(s): The hub did not write correctly to the FLASH memory
Correction(s): Contact CapstanAG to repair or replace the hub.

Cause(s): The hub did not read correctly from EEPROM memory
Correction(s): If the system does not operate correctly, first perform a Factory Reset.

Cause(s): The hub did not read correctly from EEPROM memory
Correction(s): Upload software to hub.

Cause(s): The hub did not read correctly from EEPROM memory
Correction(s): Contact CapstanAG to repair or replace the hub.

Cause(s): The hub did not write correctly to EEPROM memory
Correction(s): If the system does not operate correctly, first perform a Factory Reset.

Cause(s): The hub did not write correctly to EEPROM memory
Correction(s): Upload software to hub.

Cause(s): The hub did not write correctly to EEPROM memory
Correction(s): Contact CapstanAG to repair or replace the hub.

FAULT MESSAGE: Processor to processor communication with VCM Port 1
Cause(s): The main hub processor and VCM 1 port connector on the hub have stopped communicating.
Correction(s): If there are any unused VCM ports on the hub, remove the VCM harness from the stopped port and all subsequent ports. Skipping the stopped port, install the harnesses to remaining ports in the same order. If all of the VCM ports are in use, contact CapstanAG to repair or replace the hub.

FAULT MESSAGE: Processor to processor communication with VCM Port 2
Cause(s): The main hub processor and VCM 2 port connector on the hub have stopped communicating.
Correction(s): If there are any unused VCM ports on the hub, remove the VCM harness from the stopped port and all subsequent ports. Skipping the stopped port, install the harnesses to remaining ports in the same order. If all of the VCM ports are in use, contact CapstanAG to repair or replace the hub.

Cause(s): ISOBUS CAN is disconnected or damaged
Correction(s): Do a check of the connections for the ISOBUS CAN—ISO CAN GPS connector on hub and the harnesses on the machine.

Cause(s): ISOBUS CAN is disconnected or damaged
Correction(s): Do a check for proper termination on the ISOBUS CAN.

Cause(s): After CAN GPS is selected, the system is not receiving CAN GPS Messages. Note: Options are only visible on the display if the system detects that they are available.
Correction(s): Verify the GPS source and change if necessary.

FAULT CODE: Fault 27: No CAN Lat/ Lon Message
Cause(s): After CAN GPS is selected the system is not receiving CAN latitude and longitude GPS Messages. Note: Options are only visible on the display if the system detects that they are available.
Correction(s): Verify GPS source is transmitting Lat/Lon.

FAULT CODE: Fault 27: No CAN Lat/ Lon Message
Cause(s): After CAN GPS is selected the system is not receiving CAN latitude and longitude GPS Messages. Note: Options are only visible on the display if the system detects that they are available.
Correction(s): Verify the GPS source and change if necessary.

FAULT CODE: Fault 28: No CAN Course Over Ground/ Speed Over Ground Message
FAULT MESSAGE: No CAN Course Over Ground/ Speed Over Ground Message
Cause(s): After CAN GPS is selected the system is not receiving CAN bearing and speed GPS Messages. Note: Options are only visible on the display if the system detects that they are available.
Correction(s): Verify GPS source is transmitting bearing and speed.

FAULT CODE: Fault 28: No CAN Course Over Ground/ Speed Over Ground Message
FAULT MESSAGE: No CAN Course Over Ground/ Speed Over Ground Message
Cause(s): After CAN GPS is selected the system is not receiving CAN bearing and speed GPS Messages. Note: Options are only visible on the display if the system detects that they are available.
Correction(s): Verify the GPS source and change if necessary.

Change the VTG message rate to at least 10 Hz on the GPS receiver

FAULT MESSAGE: VCM drop 1 controller version does not match the Hub application

Correction(s): Perform a factory reset or software reset to trigger VCM drop bootload

Cause(s): Coil wire is pinched, cut, broken, or disconnected
Correction(s): Check the coil connection and resistance: • 7-watt coils resistance — 21 ohms to 23.5 ohms • 12-watt coils resistance — 10 ohms to 11.5 ohms

Cause(s): Internal coil short: Coil wire is pinched, cut, or broken
Correction(s): Check the coil connection and resistance: • 7-watt coils resistance — 21 ohms to 23.5 ohms • 12-watt coils resistance — 10 ohms to 11.5 ohms

Correction(s): Replace the O-ring
Replace the plunger

FAULT MESSAGE: Single nozzle valve will not shut off
Correction(s): Clean the nozzle valve

FAULT MESSAGE: Single nozzle valve will not shut off
Correction(s): Replace the O-ring
Repair or replace the VCM
Repair or replace the VCM extension harness

Cause(s): Rate controller is not activating the section
Correction(s): Make sure that the section signal is getting to the hub.

Cause(s): Rate controller is not activating the section
Correction(s): Repair or replace the rate controller components.

FAULT MESSAGE: Skips at the edges of a field
Cause(s): Overlap distance is set too low
Correction(s): Increase the overlap distance to at least 40”

FAULT MESSAGE: Skips at the edges of a field
Correction(s): Check the measurements to the GPS antenna location

FAULT MESSAGE: Skips at the edges of a field
Cause(s): The display overlap settings are incorrect
Correction(s): Set the look ahead time and overlap distance to prevent skips

FAULT MESSAGE: Skips at the edges of a field
Correction(s): Make sure that the ball valves are turning on soon enough or turning off late enough
Install tips of the correct size

Check the low rates with a Wilger Quick Calibrator (or similar) or with a catch time test at each nozzle: • Oz/min per nozzle = GPA x Test Speed (mph) x Nozzle Spacing (inches) / (5940 x 128) • Oz/min per nozzle = G/1000 ft² x Test Speed (mph) x Nozzle Spacing (inches) / (136 x 128)
Inspect the filters and replace as needed
Make sure that the filters are installed correctly
Make sure that the lines are clean and do not have any kinks
Make sure that each shutoff valve is fully open

Cause(s): Control Valve Type: Use A, B, C, or D as it applies to your Machine
Correction(s): A. Pressure set too low on the flow by-pass lines Make sure that the settings on each • pressure controlled by-pass valve are correct B. In-line Servo flow control valve is stuck • Make sure that the Servo flow control valve is operating correctly C. Servo signal wire polarity is switched Make sure that the valve opens with a • rate increase Make sure that the valve closes with a • rate decrease D. Top PWM valve is set too low • Adjust the rate controller PWM valve to the desired setting

Cause(s): Electric Servo Valve pump control is stuck
Correction(s): Make sure that the electric Servo pump control is operating correctly
Change the rate to observe whether the rate change is slow, limited, or does not change at all. Replace as needed
Speed data error
Incorrect speed calibration number
Poor GPS satellite reception/number of satellites
Spraying too fast which outruns the liquid system capability
Remove the rate smoothing feature

Put the rate controller in manual mode at a test speed Note: Putting the rate controller in manual mode will lock the Servo valve position unless the valve position is changed manually. If the rate becomes stable: • Worn Servo Valve • Worn PWM Valve If the rate remains unstable, the issue is usually the flowmeter signal instability. Manually increase the rate. The rate and pressure should increase. If the rate does not increase: • Worn Servo Valve • Worn PWM Valve Manually decrease the rate. The rate and pressure should decrease. If the rate does not decrease: • Worn Servo Valve • Worn PWM Valve

Cause(s): Worn tips or tips that are too big
Correction(s): Install tips of the correct size

Cause(s): Worn tips or tips that are too big
Correction(s): Check the low rates with a Wilger Quick Calibrator (or similar) or with a catch time test at each nozzle: • Oz/min per nozzle = GPA x Test Speed (mph) x Nozzle Spacing (inches) / (5940 x 128) • Oz/min per nozzle = G/1000 ft² x Test Speed (mph) x Nozzle Spacing (inches) / (136 x 128)
Adjust the speed calibration setting

Cause(s): Check the rate controller calibration values
Correction(s): Check the valve type and change if necessary

Cause(s): Check the rate controller calibration values
Correction(s): Check the valve calibration. Refer to the rate controller information for the cal number for the specific valve type
Inspect the Servo valve and replace as needed
Inspect the PWM valve and replace as needed
Make sure that the flowmeter signal is correct
Inspect all hoses and replace as needed
Isolate the display from the rate controller and then put the system in manual mode at 50%
Inspect the rate controller pressure sensor and replace as needed
Make sure that the rate controller calibration values are correct
